title: Sergej Sekulović
text: Sergej Sekulović (<a href="Montenegrin%20language">Montenegrin Cyrillic</a>: Сергеј Секуловић; born 1978 in <a href="Podgorica">Titograd</a>) is a <a href="Montenegro">Montenegrin</a> lawyer and <a href="independent%20politician">independent politician</a> who is currently serving as the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Internal%20Affairs%20%28Montenegro%29">Minister of Internal Affairs</a> in the <a href="Government%20of%20Montenegro">Government of Montenegro</a> and the <a href="Krivokapi%C4%87%20Cabinet">cabinet</a> of <a href="Zdravko%20Krivokapi%C4%87">Zdravko Krivokapić</a> since 4 December 2020 when he replaced <a href="Mevludin%20Nuhod%C5%BEi%C4%87">Mevludin Nuhodžić</a> of the <a href="Democratic%20Party%20of%20Socialists">Democratic Party of Socialists</a>. He has a master's degree in <a href="human%20rights">human rights</a> and is a <a href="Activism">civic activist</a>. He served as a legal advisor to the <a href="President%20of%20the%20Parliament%20of%20Montenegro">President of the Parliament of Montenegro</a> <a href="Ranko%20Krivokapi%C4%87">Ranko Krivokapić</a> and also was an advisor to the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Labor%20and%20Social%20Welfare%20%28Montenegro%29">Minister of Labor and Social Welfare</a> Boris Marić in the <a href="%C4%90ukanovi%C4%87%20VI%20Cabinet%23Provisional%20government">provisional government in 2016</a>, and previously a member of the centre-right <a href="Movement%20for%20Changes">Movement for Changes</a> (PzP) of <a href="Neboj%C5%A1a%20Medojevi%C4%87">Nebojša Medojević</a> until his removal from the party in 2010. Since July 2021, he has also been acting <a href="Ministry%20of%20Justice%20and%20Human%20and%20Minority%20Rights">Minister of Justice and Human and Minority Rights of Montenegro</a>, until the selection of a new minister.
